jobs.Description: HackMerced's Graphic Designer will use their creative skills to make graphics for things such as HackMerced stickers, T-Shirts, and logos.  Will also work with the marketing team.
HackMerced's UI/UX Designer will use their creative skills to make graphics and mock ups for an elegant website design.

The Hardware Engineer will be in charge of developing and implementing workshops for the hackathon. Handling the hardware lab during our main event. Being a mentor for those who would like to take on any form of hardware as their project. Last but not least work hands on with a multitude of hardware projects after the big event.
Optional: Experience in programming: C/C++, Java, Python, MIPS

jobs.Description: The logistics director will work with various departments within HackMerced to book venues, develop and run schedules, and order services and supplies.
Optional: Experience in event planning outside UC Merced

jobs.Description: The logistics co-director will work along-side the logistics director to coordinate, plan and create events at UC Merced and the Merced community.
Requirements: Experience in throwing events at UC Merced
Can envision themselves being a director for the following year
Optional: Experience in using room reservation software
Experience in event planning outside UC Merced

jobs.Description: The Product Manager, Front End is perfect for students interested in Product Management roles in the future, they will work with a team of front-end software engineers to create HackMerced's website, admission tools, and other projects to build out the service HackMerced provides to students. They will work primarily on HackMerced's main platform, dealing with their front-end React website. They will be handling project deadlines, project vision and goals.
Requirements: Proficiency in one of the following: HTML, CSS, Javascript
Experience in MVC ecosystems (React, Angular, Vue)
Willing to learn and work on a team

jobs.Description: The director of finance will help secure sponsorships, makes sure vendors get paid, and manage the cash flow and budget.
Requirements: Manages budget and controls expenses effectively.
Optional: Worked in a financial-related position before

jobs.Description: Will work along-side the Director of Finance.
Requirements: Manages budget and controls expenses effectively.
Optional: Can envision themselves being a director for the following year
Worked in a financial-related position before

jobs.Description: The Director of Marketing will be planning and coordinating marketing campaigns for HackMerced, that can include emails, social media posts, blogs, and video. They also work with the Student Event Manager to build and create non-primary Hackathon events.
Requirements: Proficient and independent in drafting up e-mails
Optional: Has a blog, medium, or publishes content online
Has done social media management in the past

jobs.Description: The Co-Director of Marketing will work alongside with the Director of Marketing.
Optional: Can envision themselves being a director for the following year
Has a blog, medium, or publishes content online
Has done social media management in the past

jobs.Description: HackMerced’s full stack software engineering position will allow you stretch your skills in full-stack development to build out and maintain HackMerced’s core platform to their greatest potential in Facebook’s React MVC framework and Node.js and MongoDB.  You will use your ninja skills to work with the front-end and back-end engineers. You will also be paired with a software engineer as your mentor.
Requirements: Willing to learn and work on a team
Optional: Proficiency in one of the following: Javascript, HTML, CSS
Proficiency in one of the following: Javascript or Python

jobs.Description: HackMerced’s front end software engineering position will allow you stretch your skills in Front End development to build out and maintain HackMerced’s core platform including products such as our website, Tomoe, Helix, and Core to their greatest potential in Facebook’s React MVC framework.  You will be working in a team of 1-3 front-end engineers along with the back-end and full stack team.
Requirements: Proficiency in one of the following: HTML, CSS, Javascript
Experience in MVC ecosystems (React, Angular, Vue, Ionic, Gatsby)
Willing to learn and work on a team

jobs.Description: HackMerced’s Digital Media Strategist works to produce easy to consume and informative writing in the form of blog posts to promote HackMerced online. The Digital Media Strategist will work with the Community Relations Director to produce a captivating marketing strategy works that relate to technology and HackMerced.
Optional: Has writing portfolio with published articles, social media marketing presence

jobs.Description: HackMerced’s Email Content Strategist works to produce emails for HackMerced that will inform students about HackMerced’s events and activities as well as works with the Digital Media Strategist to produce blog content.

HackMerced’s Social Media Specialist works to manage the social media activity of HackMerced. They will work with the Marketing Director to make interesting and informative posts for HackMerced as well as communicate and interact with the HackMerced community online.
Optional: Experience with Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter

jobs.Description: HackMerced’s PR Specialist works with the Social Media Specialist and Director of Marketing to plan, create, and deploy efficient, entertaining, and informative marketing content to bring students to HackMerced.

The Marketing Manager will use their knowledge of human relations to help secure sponsorships with companies. They will be emailing sponsors, providing them requested information, and will be working with the Marketing Director.
Requirements: Responds to emails in a timely manner
Experienced in writing emails in a professional environment

jobs.Description: As the IT support specialist, you will be working during HackMerced events and activities to ensure HackMerced remains online. You will also be assisting fellow HackMerced workers set up safe and secure work environments and resolve internal technical issues.
Requirements: Dedication to securing an organization's infrastructure
Optional: Experience with Enterprise Level software configuration

jobs.Description: As the Volunteer Manager you will have the responsibility of recruiting, managing and educating potential volunteers for HackMerced events.
Optional: Excellent skills in Microsoft Office products such as Excel and Word

jobs.Description: The Student Event Manager will work to create, organize, and run non-Hackathon HackMerced events. They are self-guided with support from the director of HackMerced and from the logistics director to successfully hold events both during and outside the hackathon. They will work with our administration, Event Logistics, and Finance Teams to procure what they need to throw an event. These events range from workshops to tabling.
Requirements: Experience in running and planning events
Optional: Experience in running event at UC Merced

jobs.Description: The Student Liaison Manager works with students from other schools to establish the HackMerced brand at their respective campuses. They will recruit students at those campuses to advertise the event for sign-ups.
Requirements: Students with connections to other universities, including student, staff and faculty
Optional: Experience in building and leading a team

jobs.Description: Reporting analyst at HackMerced will predict trends in spending and growth. Build budgets for events as well as locate areas to cut costs and research new ways to efficiently spend money.
Optional: Experience in budgeting Experience in working at a club at UCM as a Treasurer

jobs.Description: Don't know which position to apply for but still want to contribute to Hack Merced?  Apply to this 'other' position and we can work something out.
